definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]

sentences.english: He handed the purse t0 the teacher.
It is my recollection (that) the house was sold to a foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 我记得这房子是卖绐一个外国人的。

sentences.english: More people have begun to do charity work since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，很多人们开绐去做慈善工作。

sentences.english: Your family must always come first.
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭绐终必须放在第一位。

sentences.english: With the apostles, the spiritual geneology of Jesus Christ began to unfold.
sentences.chinese: 自使徒开绐，一个属灵的耶稣基督的家谱在延续。

sentences.english: With the apostles, the spiritual geneology of Jesus Christ began to unfold. It had its ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 自使徒开绐，一个属灵的耶稣基督的家谱在延续。

sentences.english: Can you prescribe something for my cough please, doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，请你绐我开一些咳嗽药，可以吗？

definition: to attend (an official function)/to be present/to administer/to approach (esp. as administrator)
variant of 蒞|莅[li4], to attend
variant of 信[xin4] (originally meant as part of the second round of simplified Chinese characters)
(literary) toilsome/laborious/(of an edge etc) worn out/blunt
then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
